intro: Calochortus palmeri var. paludicola, commonly known as the marsh marigold, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in wetland or marshy habitats. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is adapted to moist, well-drained soils. Calochortus palmeri var. paludicola plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is of interest in botanical conservation efforts.
